Repositories and tools for large-scale analysis of gene-expression data

  • Gene Expression Omnibus (a huge repository of large-scale gene-expression experiments)
  • Mouse Gene Expression Database
  • Gemma (co-expression analysis to identify genes with similar expression profiles)

Protein interaction databases

  • BioGRID database of physical and genetic interactions
  • IntAct

Gene and protein network tools

  • STRING database
  • Gene Mania tool

Cancer gene-expression and disease-associated mutations

  • Analyze mutation patterns of these genes in diverse cancers and diseases
  • What diseases are the mutations associated with?
  • In which cancer tumours are the mutations most prevalent?
  • What are the consequences in terms of protein function of these mutations?
  • Resources
    • Cosmic database of somatic mutations in cancer
    • HGMD database
    • OMIM database
    • The Cancer Genome Atlas (TCGA)
    • The Cancer Dependency Map (large-scale knock-out screens)

Gene Ontology and other useful sources of information

  • Gene Ontology
  • GeneCards
  • Other biological databases

Additional software for this tutorial

  • Download and install the Scaffold Software (for spectral count analysis)
  • Download and install X!Tandem (to run the GPM search engine from the command line)
  • Download and unzip this human SwissProt fasta sequence file
  • Parameters, input and output are all specified in xml files when running X!Tandem from the command line
